channel.title: Need PHP help manking a simple wordpress footer!
channel.description:
Well I want a simple footer in wordpress but I do not know how to make one in PHP. If anybody could do this real fast I would be very thankful, I'm sure it won't take more than 2 minutes at the most.
This is the footer of the Google Analyctics page. I want my Wordpress PHP footer pretty much exactly like that. Of course my links and stuff wouldn't be the same, but I have enough knowledge of basic webdesign that I can change those myself. Thanks to anybody that does it!
[img]http://www.freeimagehosting.net/uploads/32f16879e1.jpg[/img]

item.title: Need PHP help manking a simple wordpress footer!
item.dc:creator: @mjordan mjordan
item.description:
@mjordan wrote:

[quote=“Wewt, post:2, topic:318783”]Why not just copy google’s HTML and paste it in your footer file?
Then, when you want to, let’s say, print your blog’s title, use:

[code]

<?php bloginfo('name'); ?>

[/code]Well if you could translate it from HTML to PHP that would be very helpful.

More about bloginfo: http://codex.wordpress.org/Template_Tags/bloginfo

I’ll take a look into making it later today, though. But if you want to give it a go, go right ahead :)[/quote]

Read full topic
item.source: Need PHP help manking a simple wordpress footer!

@Wewt wrote:

Why not just copy google’s HTML and paste it in your footer file?
Then, when you want to, let’s say, print your blog’s title, use:
